data.1bb0731c-c2b9-11ea-a1e8-0242ac120007:
1. ॐ नम: श्री महा{भैरवाय} । ३ । श्रेयोऽस्तु ।

  2. सम्वत् ८१४ चैत्र कृष्ण त्रयोदशी प्र चतुर्द्दशी, उ-

  3. त्त्रभद्र प्र रेवती नक्षत्र, वृहस्पतिवार, थ्वकुन्हु श्री-

  4. मत श्रीश्री महाभैरव भट्टारकासके खपिनिछे जित्र-

  5. सिंह प्रजापति, मालसिंह धंतुलि, पुनसिंह धंतु-

  6. लि, मालसिंह भावो, बदे भावो, मनिसिंह भावो,

  7. वासिंह भावो, पुनसिंह धंतुलि, मनिसिंह धंतु-

  8. लि, कृष्णराम भावो, बुसिंह भावो, छेह्योय[1] बुसिं-

  9. ह भावो, भागीराम लं, माहान देवसिंह भावो,

  10. नयनसिंह भावो, बदे भावो, भागीसिंह भावो,

  11. धर्म्मसिंह भावो, मानसिंह भावो, माधवसिंह

  12. भावो, मानसिंह धंगुलि, थ्वते समूहन चतु-

  13. र्द्दशी सेवा दयकं थ्व चपाड लिवने छे दङा-

  14. व प्रतिष्ठा याङा दिन जुरो । यथाशास्त्रोक्त-

  15. फलमस्तु । शुभ ।

  16. Footnotes

    1. ^ A similar term छेम्होय (chemhoya) appears in another inscription from the same monument (LAL_1780_0002). The unclear term appears to be a name of a nearby locality.
data.374255f0-c2b9-11ea-ac0e-0242ac120007:
1. oṃ namaḥ śrī mahā{bhairavāya} । 3 । śreyo 'stu ।

  2. samvat 814 caitra kṛṣṇa trayodaśī pra caturddaśī, u-

  3. ttrabhadra pra revatī nakṣatra, vṛhaspativāra, thvakunhu śrī-

  4. mata śrīśrī mahābhairava bhaṭṭārakāsake khapiniche jitra-

  5. siṃha prajāpati, mālasiṃha dhaṃtuli, punasiṃha dhaṃtu-

  6. li, mālasiṃha bhāvo, bade bhāvo, manisiṃha bhāvo,

  7. vāsiṃha bhāvo, punasiṃha dhaṃtuli, manisiṃha dhaṃtu-

  8. li, kṛṣṇarāma bhāvo, busiṃha bhāvo, chehyoya busiṃ-

  9. ha bhāvo, bhāgīrāma laṃ, māhāna devasiṃha bhāvo,

  10. nayanasiṃha bhāvo, bade bhāvo, bhāgīsiṃha bhāvo,

  11. dharmmasiṃha bhāvo, mānasiṃha bhāvo, mādhavasiṃha

  12. bhāvo, mānasiṃha dhaṃguli, thvate samūhana catu-

  13. rddaśī sevā dayakaṃ thva capāḍa livane che daṅā-

  14. va pratiṣṭhā yāṅā dina juro । yathāśāstrokta-

  15. phalam astu । śubha ।

data.bb5ef1b6-990d-11ea-82af-0242ac130005: A stone slab inscription at the Khapiṃchẽ Bhairava Mandira in Khapiṃchẽ Ṭola, Patan re the formation of a guṭhī and construction of a building (NS 814)

data.d91cb788-990d-11ea-9766-0242ac130005: This inscription records the formation of the Caturdaśī Sevā Guthi and construction of a new building behind the Khapiṃchẽ Bhairava Mandira.

data.c2d1328c-19dd-11eb-bd1f-0242ac120002: A few letters are not clearly readable because they have been slightly covered by substances.

data.e3735d6e-6210-11eb-9e66-0242ac130009: An image of Kāla Bhairava is carved at the top of the slab. He is flanked by images of sun and moon.

data.f05cef86-c2ba-11ea-ac0e-0242ac120007: Bharat Maharjan and Rajendra Shakya in collaboration with Rajan Khatiwoda

data.995c8a8c-c2bc-11ea-ac0e-0242ac120007: LAL1780_I_005 A stone slab inscription at the Khapiṃchẽ Bhairava Mandira in Khapiṃchẽ Ṭola, Patan (NS 814)

data.c0dc905a-9910-11ea-9766-0242ac130005:
Khapiṃchẽ Bhairava Mandira, location map (drawing by Niels Gutschow and Bijay Basukala, 1990, updated by Bibek Basukala, May 2020)

Khapiṃchẽ Bhairava Mandira, site plan (drawing by Sabina Tandukar, March 2019)

data.2a4115cc-444f-11eb-8cb5-0242ac130007: On Thursday, the 13th/14th of the dark fortnight of Caitra in NS 814 (1694 CE), Jitrasiṃha Prajāpati and 20 others of Khapiṃchẽ formed a trust named Caturdaśī Sevā [that worships Lord Bhairava on the 14th of the dark fortnight every month] and constructed a new building behind this capāḥ. Let the merits as described in the scriptures be fulfilled by the accomplishment of this act.
data.440f482a-444f-11eb-8822-0242ac130007: नेसं ८१४ चैत्र कृष्ण त्रयोदशी-चतुर्दशी विहिवारको दिनमा खपिंछेँका जित्रसिंह प्रजापति, मालसिंह धंतुलि, पुनसिंह धंतुलि, मालसिंह भावो, बदे भावो, मनिसिंह भावो, वासिंह भावो, पुनसिंह धंतुलि, मनिसिंह धंतुलि, कृष्णराम भावो, बुसिंह भावो, यबुसिंह भावो, भागीराम लं माहान, देवसिंह भावो, नयनसिंह भावो, बदे भावो, भागीसिंह भावो, धर्म्मसिंह भावो, मानसिंह भावो, माधवसिंह भावो, मानसिंह धंगुलिको समूहले मिलेर खपिंछेँ भैरवको सेवा गर्न चतुर्दशी सेवा गुठी बनाएर भैरवको चपा: पछाडि घर बनाइदिए । यो कार्य गरेवापत शास्त्रमा लेखिएबमोजम फल मिलोस् ।

data.30ccd388-4a8d-11eb-85ba-0242ac130009: Only the first and last line are written in Sanskrit.

data.2591e954-9a98-11ea-82af-0242ac130005: Khapiṃchẽ Bhairava Mandira at Khapiṃchẽ Ṭola, stone slab inscription from NS 814, view from W; photo by Yogesh Budathoki; 2019-03-29

data.83f4a4a4-990e-11ea-9766-0242ac130005:
This inscription records two events: formation of a trust named Caturdaśī Sevā and construction of a new building behind the capāḥ. Interestingly, other inscriptions from the same monument (LAL_1780_0006 and LAL_1780_0002), dated NS 794 (1674 CE) and NS 802 (1682 CE) respectively, also record setting up a Caturdaśī Sevā Guthi, which basically is a religious service dedicated to a certain deity performed on the 14th of the dark fortnight of every lunar month. It is likely that the guthi was in existence even before 1674 CE and was regularly being reconstituted or additional activities were being introduced in the religious service, which were recorded in these inscriptions. The names of some of the donors appear in all three inscriptions. Unfortunately, this service is no longer performed at the Khapiṃchẽ Bhairava temple.
The inscription refers to the temple as a capāḥ, although we know that it already took the shape of a degaḥ two decades ago. For more on this, see LAL_1780_0006. The new building constructed behind the capāḥ was probably the guthi house that still exists.

data.2351e7ee-9911-11ea-82af-0242ac130005: Śākya, Hemrāj. Akṣeśvara Mahāvihāra Pūco chagū adhyayana. Lalitpur: Bauddha Vihāra Saṅgha, 1995.

data.995c8a8c-c2bc-11ea-ac0e-0242ac120007: LAL0630_I_002 A copper-plate inscription at Khaḍgayoginī, Puldvã/Dānāgiri Ṭola, Lalitpur re an offering of a gilt canopy by Jahalasiṃ Vajrācārya, his wife Dhantalakṣmī and sons Pūrṇajoti, Ratnajoti and Bhīmajoti (NS 1002)

data.bb5ef1b6-990d-11ea-82af-0242ac130005: A copper-plate inscription at Khaḍgayoginī, Puldvã/Dānāgiri Ṭola, Lalitpur re an offering of a gilt canopy by Jahalasiṃ Vajrācārya, his wife Dhantalakṣmī and sons Pūrṇajoti, Ratnajoti and Bhīmajoti (NS 1002)

data.d4ba6b94-6212-11eb-aaf1-0242ac130009:
NS 1002 (friday, the 14th of the dark fortnight of Āṣāḍha)

Jahalasiṃ Vajrācārya, his wife Dhantalakṣmī and sons Pūrṇajoti, Ratnajoti and Bhīmajoti offered a gilt canopy (ilā̃) of 11 dhārnī (2.393 kg) and 11 metal lamps to Khaḍagayoginī.

data.2cfe60a8-6213-11eb-9e66-0242ac130009:
• Description: One of the Vajrācārya clans from Bū Bāhāḥ (LAL0440) is responsible to carry out the daily rituals in Khaḍgayoginī Mandira and also to maintain it. Only the respective clan member who is initiated is permitted to worship Khaḍgayoginī.

    Reference source: Priest of the temple, Vajrācārya, male, age 59

  • Description: Khaḍgayoginī is believed to be one of the Ten Mother Goddesses (Daśamahāvidyā) in the Hindu tantric tradition (particularly in Shaktism). Therefore, the Śākta followers worship her as Tārā every year on the eighth day of the bright fortnight of Bhādra during the huge celebration of the Ten Mahāvidyā’s procession in Patan.

    Reference source: Priest of the temple, Vajrācārya, male, age 59

  • Description: Certain people from a certain city quarter or Ṭola form a group and collectively worship the Four Yoginīs (Yoginī Sīkaḥ Vanegu) of the Kathmandu Valley one day every year (this is called Yoginīsīkaḥvanegu in Newari). On the same day, they also visit the Khaḍgayoginī temple and worship her.

    Reference source: Priest of the temple, Vajrācārya, male, age 59

  • Description: The bride and groom from the locality come to perform the engagement ceremony (svayamvara ritual) in the presence of Khaḍayoginī before the actual marriage rites take place.

    Reference source: Priest of the temple, Vajrācārya, male, age 59

  • Description:  The residents of Pulchok and Patan come to worship Khaḍgayoginī during the birth day of their family members in order to get rid of the evil affects due to the bad constellations of the stars (this worship is called Kalaḥpūjā).

    Reference source: Priest of the temple, Vajrācārya, male, age 59

  • Description: A guṭhī of the Śreṣṭhas (Malekū) of Pulchok is related to this temple. It has only five members at present and sponsors a special ritual worship for Khaḍgayoginī on the full moon day of Maṅsira followed by a community feast.

    Reference source: Priest of the temple, Vajrācārya, male, age 59; Member of the guṭhī, Malekū, male, age 52

  • Description: There is a tradition that someone whose house is burnt down should come to this temple and worship Khaḍgayoginī within four days (this tradition is called Mĩnaḥguyāpūjā).

    Reference source: Priest of the temple, Vajrācārya, male, age 59; Member of the guṭhī, Malekū, male, age 52; Local resident, Maharjana, male, age 69

  • Description: Every year, on the 2nd day of the dark fortnight of Bhādra, the Matayāḥ procession (Śṛṅgabherī Yātrā) takes place in Lalitpur. A large group of people playing music visits various caityas and the aśoka stūpas of Patan. The group also visits the caityas of this temple premises. 

    Reference source: Priest of the temple, Vajrācārya, male, age 59

data.374255f0-c2b9-11ea-ac0e-0242ac120007:
1. śubhaḥ saṃvat 1002 mti ākhaḍha kṛṣṇayākhaḥ caturdasyātithauḥ ārḍhā nakṣatreḥ vyāghātajoge jathākarṇamuhūrtte śukravālasareḥ mithunarāsi (savitriḥ) tatraiva rāsigate (candra)
2. masiḥ etatdineḥ dānāgirināmanagaraḥ subhasthānye virājitaḥ śrī3 khaḍgajoginī devīyāta (yuddhajaya)dharanāmna vihāraḥ (varūṃsi yāhmāsa vijyāka ka vakrā
3. cāryya śrī jahalasiṃḥ bhāryāḥ dhaṇalakṣmiḥ putra śrīpūrṇnajoti dvitiya śrī ratnajotiḥ titṛya śrībhimajotiḥ putra ++sakala jalabhocchi siyāṃ dharmmacitta utpattī juyā
4. oḥ pāta 1 lilayā ināmasaḥ lūnaṃ siyā oḥ duntā julo kadhmani 3॥ du jalaprapāta 11 jula divā duntā jula śubhaṃ ॥ * ॥
data.f524c98c-c2b8-11ea-a1e8-0242ac120007:
१. शुभः संवत् १००२ म्ति आखढ कृष्णयाखः चतुर्दस्यातिथौः आर्ढा नक्षत्रेः व्याघातजोगे जथाकर्णमुहूर्त्ते शुक्रवालसरेः मिथुनरासि (सवित्रिः) तत्रैव रासिगते (चन्द्र)

२. मसिः एतत्दिनेः दानागिरिनामनगरः सुभस्थान्ये विराजितः श्री३ खड्गजोगिनी देवीयात (युद्धजय)धरनाम्न विहारः (वरूंसि याह्मास विज्याक क वक्रा

३. चार्य्य श्री जहलसिंः भार्याः धणलक्ष्मिः पुत्र श्रीपूर्ण्नजोति द्वितिय श्री रत्नजोतिः तितृय श्रीभिमजोतिः पुत्र ++सकल जलभोच्छि सियां धर्म्मचित्त उत्पत्ती जुया

४. ओः पात १ लिलया इनामसः लूनं सिया ओः दुन्ता जुलो कध्मनि ३॥ दु जलप्रपात ११ जुल दिवा दुन्ता जुल शुभं ॥ * ॥

data.e3735d6e-6210-11eb-9e66-0242ac130009: The inscription is on the base of the Pañca Buddha statues, beneath the esoteric deity (kvāḥpāḥdyaḥ).

data.83f4a4a4-990e-11ea-9766-0242ac130005: It is fragmented, and so the date and event is not clearly readable. The inscription mentions that Viso Siṃ was a caretaker. It also mentions that everyone must respect the wishes of the donors. It states that any act contrary to their wishes would be sinful and equivalent to killing a Brāhmaṇa.

data.2cfe60a8-6213-11eb-9e66-0242ac130009:
• Description: The annual festival was observed on the full moon day of Bhadra (Locke 1985, 72), but is now observed on the full moon day of Āśvina. A Vajrācārya from Kumbheśvara is appointed to perform the ritual. An umbrella is also offered on that day.

    Reference source: None

  • Description: Bhajana is performed during the month of Gũlā (Śrāvaṇa) in the courtyard of the Bāhāḥ.

    Reference source: None

  • Description: This is a private monastery constructed by the Prajāpati family. The daily ritual worship is regularly performed by a Prajāpati family member.

    Reference source: None

data.83f4a4a4-990e-11ea-9766-0242ac130005: Towards the east of the śikharakūṭa caitya one can find an statue of a donor. The donor sits on a lotus and is facing west. Śākya (1994, 89) states that this is the statue of Lohaṃmaṇi Āju. There is an inscription behind the statue, which has been carved in the same stone. The lower part of the inscription of NS 793 is broken. Any information about the person who installed it has therefore been lost. However, some text can still be deciphered, telling the reader that images of Amoghapāśa Lokeśvara and Ārya Tārā were installed.

data.d4ba6b94-6212-11eb-aaf1-0242ac130009:
NS 793 (Wednesday, the 7th of the bright fortnight of Āṣāḍha)

The statues of Amoghapāśa Lokeśvara and Ārya Tārā on the sides of the main deity inside the sanctum were consecrated.

data.2cfe60a8-6213-11eb-9e66-0242ac130009:
• Description: H. Śākya mentions that Śrīnivāsa Malla (r. 1661-1685), the King of Patan, was invited to visit this bāhāḥ in 1667 (NS 787) on the occasion of the samyak mahādāna performance. The king sat on a golden throne placed at the pāsukhā jhyāḥ, which was on the north wing. From here, he watched the ritual. 

    In NS 783 and together with the workers who had worked on the construction of the bāhāḥ, the founder of the monastry Jothāju helped King Śrīnivāsa Malla in the process of extending the palace building. The king was ultimately pleased with Jothāju’s work, and gave him a horse as a gift. According to the Nepālikabhūpavaṃśāvalī  (2016: 129), this event took place during the reign of King Viṣṇu Malla (r. NS 849-865). However, Jothāju passed away in 795, which suggests that the event actually took place in the reign of King Śrīnivāsa Malla. 
    Jothāju sold the horse and used the money to buy land. The land was named Salakhvāḥ Bũ. Using the income from this field, Jothāju also established a guṭhī for the management of Rudravarṇa Mahāvihāra.

    Reference source: Nepālikabhūpavaṃśāvalī

data.bb5ef1b6-990d-11ea-82af-0242ac130005: A stone slab inscription at Umāmaheśvara, Cāka Bāhāḥ Ṭola, Lalitpur re the reconstruction of temple by Viśvambhara Bhāro (NS 796)

data.e3735d6e-6210-11eb-9e66-0242ac130009: archway-like shape; nine Śivaliṅga on lotus pedestals adorn the text of the inscription

data.374255f0-c2b9-11ea-ac0e-0242ac120007:
1. ⟅ oṃ namaḥ śivāya ॥ bhujaṅgopavītaṃ, bhujaṃgāvataṃśaṃ, śaratkoṭicandraprabhaṃ candracūḍaṃ ॥

2. girīśaṃ girīśātmajeśaṃ maheśaṃ, gaveśāna āsīnamīśānamīḍe ॥ śrī śrī śrīnivāsanṛtapate

3. ḥ saciveṣu mukhyo, viśveśvarasya tanayo nayakovido'bhūt ॥ viśvambharaḥ kulasarojavikā

4. sabhānūḥ saṃgrāmakarmmanipuṇaścaturaḥ suśīlaḥ ॥ loke'tyantaparopakāramanaso viśveśva

5. rasyātmajo, nītijño'tulavikramaḥ paṭutaro viśvaṃbharo viśrutaḥ । nepāle lalitāpurīpatinṛpa

6. śrīśrīnivāsaprabhoḥ senānāṃ gaṇanāyakaḥ sasacivo jīvvyācciraṃ bhūtale ॥ tasyātmajo harapadāmbujayugmabhṛṅgo, dāmodaro vivu

7. dhasajjanasaṃrakṣaḥ । tasmādbabhūvaturubhau tanayau ca rāma, saumitrakaudaśanathādiva bālakau tau ॥ purānatanaṃ śaṃbhumaṭhaṃ sujīrṇṇamapāsyahemna

8. ḥ kalaśena hīnaṃ ॥ viśvaṃbharosay kurutesma śambhoḥ prāsādamenaṃ ca navaṃ manojñaṃ ॥ tasminneva maṭhe ramye, bhavānīśaṃkarāvubhau । tena viśvaṃ

9. bhareṇaiva, sthāpitau jagatāṃ prabhū ॥ naipālābde rasavilamunau, jyeṣṭhamāse ca śukle, vāre jīve śatadhṛtitithau rohiṇībhe śivasya ।

10. prāsāde'smin kanakakalaśaṃ, sthāpayāmāsa bhaktyā, kṛtyā homaṃ dvijavaragaṇānpūjya viśvaṃbharo'sau ॥ 0॥ atha nepālabhāṣā ॥

11. ⟅ samvat 796 jyeṣṭhamāse śuklapakṣe dvitīyāyāṃ tithau, rohiṇīnakṣatre, bṛhaspativāsare, thva kunhu cākravāhārayā paramāna viśvaṃbhara bhārosana hṇavayā (māhā)devala cācchataye

12. ri jīrṇṇa juyāva seṅāva coṅasa thava nāmna svataparidevala dayakaṃ mahārājādhirāja śrī3 nivāsamallathākula śrī2 narendramalla tho nehma thākula vijyācakaṃ śrī umāmaheśvaramūrtti

13. pratiṣṭhā yāṅāna suvarṇakalaśadhvajāvarohana yāṅā dina julo ॥ thva devayāta varṣaṃ pratinistūraye yāta, rova 7 khomoḍ ro 6 nhasibhela, rovahuvaṃ deśrāmako, thvate vūyā varasānaṃ vūsā

14. dhanasa homa yāṅana duguhmaṃ 1 hikhoyamāla, sagana yāta sacekana kuḍa 2 cākramata cchoyake, śivarātri sapaṃcāmṛta niśrāvajo 2 vyālapatrasa jonāsataṃ reṇuki 2 ṅaṃ 1 cekaṃ cākra

15. mata cchoyake, dyerapra 1 x divāmata, nityapūjāyāta,ke, svānayāta, vyephaṃ 12 niśrāva yātake phaṃ 67 dharivye? phaṃ 30 madhivye phaṃ 30 cekaṃ vyaphaṃ 30 brāhmaṇa yātamātaṅana vya ṣṭhaṃ ? 90

16. moṭaṃ 1 lenakesa hlāyāta, thvate varasānena varṣaṃpratipi< temāla, thvatiyā ciṃtāyāka siddhirāja bhāro, kalyānasiṃha bhāro, rāmacandra bhāro, harinaṃdana bhāro, thvati hlāseta

17. ko mayāta sālobhayātasā gobrāhmaṇādi hathyāyaṃ ca mahāpātaka lāka juro, hlāsetako yātasā, thvati pāpamalāka uttarottara juro ॥ 0 ॥ śubhaṃ ॥
data.f524c98c-c2b8-11ea-a1e8-0242ac120007:
१. ⟅ ॐ नमः शिवाय ॥ भुजङ्गोपवीतं, भुजंगावतंशं, शरत्कोटिचन्द्रप्रभं चन्द्रचूडं ॥

२. गिरीशं गिरीशात्मजेशं महेशं, गवेशान आसीनमीशानमीडे ॥ श्री श्री श्रीनिवासनृतपते

३. ः सचिवेषु मुख्यो, विश्वेश्वरस्य तनयो नयकोविदोऽभूत् ॥ विश्वम्भरः कुलसरोजविका

४. सभानूः संग्रामकर्म्मनिपुणश्चतुरः सुशीलः ॥ लोकेऽत्यन्तपरोपकारमनसो विश्वेश्व

५. रस्यात्मजो, नीतिज्ञोऽतुलविक्रमः पटुतरो विश्वंभरो विश्रुतः । नेपाले ललितापुरीपतिनृप

६. श्रीश्रीनिवासप्रभोः सेनानां गणनायकः ससचिवो जीव्व्याच्चिरं भूतले ॥ तस्यात्मजो हरपदाम्बुजयुग्मभृङ्गो, दामोदरो विवु

७. धसज्जनसंरक्षः । तस्माद्बभूवतुरुभौ तनयौ च राम, सौमित्रकौदशनथादिव बालकौ तौ ॥ पुरानतनं शंभुमठं सुजीर्ण्णमपास्यहेम्न

८. ः कलशेन हीनं ॥ विश्वंभरोसय् कुरुतेस्म शम्भोः प्रासादमेनं च नवं मनोज्ञं ॥ तस्मिन्नेव मठे रम्ये, भवानीशंकरावुभौ । तेन विश्वं

९. भरेणैव, स्थापितौ जगतां प्रभू ॥ नैपालाब्दे रसविलमुनौ, ज्येष्ठमासे च शुक्ले, वारे जीवे शतधृतितिथौ रोहिणीभे शिवस्य ।

१०. प्रासादेऽस्मिन् कनककलशं, स्थापयामास भक्त्या, कृत्या होमं द्विजवरगणान्पूज्य विश्वंभरोऽसौ ॥ ०॥ अथ नेपालभाषा ॥

११. ⟅ सम्वत् ७९६ ज्येष्ठमासे शुक्लपक्षे द्वितीयायां तिथौ, रोहिणीनक्षत्रे, बृहस्पतिवासरे, थ्व कुन्हु चाक्रवाहारया परमान विश्वंभर भारोसन ह्णवया (माहा)देवल चाच्छतये

१२. रि जीर्ण्ण जुयाव सेङाव चोङस थव नाम्न स्वतपरिदेवल दयकं महाराजाधिराज श्री३ निवासमल्लथाकुल श्री२ नरेन्द्रमल्ल थो नेह्म थाकुल विज्याचकं श्री उमामहेश्वरमूर्त्ति

१३. प्रतिष्ठा याङान सुवर्णकलशध्वजावरोहन याङा दिन जुलो ॥ थ्व देवयात वर्षं प्रतिनिस्तूरये यात, रोव ७ खोमोड् रो ६ न्हसिभेल, रोवहुवं देश्रामको, थ्वते वूया वरसानं वूसा

१४. धनस होम याङन दुगुह्मं १ हिखोयमाल, सगन यात सचेकन कुड २ चाक्रमत च्छोयके, शिवरात्रि सपंचामृत निश्रावजो २ व्यालपत्रस जोनासतं रेणुकि २ ङं १ चेकं चाक्र

१५. मत च्छोयके, द्येरप्र १ x दिवामत, नित्यपूजायात,के, स्वानयात, व्येफं १२ निश्राव यातके फं ६७ धरिव्ये? फं ३० मधिव्ये फं ३० चेकं व्यफं ३० ब्राह्मण यातमातङन व्य ष्ठं ? ९०

१६. मोटं १ लेनकेस ह्लायात, थ्वते वरसानेन वर्षंप्रतिपि< तेमाल, थ्वतिया चिंतायाक सिद्धिराज भारो, कल्यानसिंह भारो, रामचन्द्र भारो, हरिनंदन भारो, थ्वति ह्लासेत

१७. को मयात सालोभयातसा गोब्राह्मणादि हथ्यायं च महापातक लाक जुरो, ह्लासेतको यातसा, थ्वति पापमलाक उत्तरोत्तर जुरो ॥ ० ॥ शुभं ॥

data.995c8a8c-c2bc-11ea-ac0e-0242ac120007: LAL2750_I_001 A stone slab inscription at Umāmaheśvara, Cāka Bāhāḥ Ṭola, Lalitpur re the reconstruction of temple by Viśvambhara Bhāro (NS 796)

data.fd2469c4-c2b5-11ea-ac0e-0242ac120007: built into wall above the southern door to the temple

data.2591e954-9a98-11ea-82af-0242ac130005: Umāmaheśvara Mandira at Cāka Bāhāḥ, an inscription from  NS 796, at the southern part of temple view from S; photo by Yogesh Budathoki; 2019-02-09

data.d91cb788-990d-11ea-9766-0242ac130005: Paramāna Viśvaṁbhara Bhāro reconstructed the old three-storey temple. He consecrated a new statue of Umāmaheśvara, and golden vessels and banners were added to the temple in the presence of King Śrīnivasa Malla and Prince Yoganaredra Malla. A guṭhī was also established with the land-grants to facilitate daily ritual worship and other functions of the temple.

data.83f4a4a4-990e-11ea-9766-0242ac130005:
The stone inscription attached above the southern door of the temple mentions that the monument was reconstructed by Viśvambhara Bhāro in NS 796 (CE 1676) during the reign of King Śrīnivāsa Malla. The inscription further informs readers that the King and his son Yoganarendra Malla were also present at the consecration of the temple, where lands were bestowed and a guṭhī was established to fund its ritual worship However, these days no guṭhī lands connected to the temple could be traced. In VS 2058, local people collected donations in order to try to continue the daily and other ritual worships of the temple. They assigned a Brahmin from Agniśālā Ṭola to carry out this task. However, the earthquake 2015 further hindered the daily worship. The Cakravarti Ṭola Sudhāra Samiti (an organisation for local development) is currently responsible for opening and closing the temple.      

मन्दिरको दक्षिणी ढोकामाथि टाँसिएको नेसं ७९६ को शिलालेखमा पहिला जीर्ण अवस्थामा रहेको महादेव मन्दिर राजा श्रीनिवासका मन्त्री विश्वंभर भारोले जीर्णोद्धार गरी तीनतले बनाई उमामहेश्वरको मूर्ति स्थापना गरेको जानकारी दिइएको छ । उक्त अवसरमा राजा श्रीनिवास र उनका छोरा योगनरेन्द्र मल्ल पनि उपस्थित भएको कुरा पनि सोही अभिलेखमा लेखिएको छ । मन्दिरको नित्यपूजा एवं अन्य विशेष पूजाको निमित्त जग्गा दान गरी गुठीको व्यवस्था गरेको चर्चा पनि अभिलेखमा परेको छ तर हाल यो मन्दिरको कुनै गुठी एवं जग्गा अस्तित्वमा भएको देखिँदैन । विसं २०५८ सालमा स्थानीयको चन्दाबाट अग्निशाला टोलका ब्राह्मणलाई नित्यपूजाको निम्ति नियुक्त गरेदेखि निरन्तर नित्यपूजा चल्दैआएकोमा गत २०७२ सालको भूकम्पपश्चात् नित्यपूजा बन्द भएको अवस्था छ । हाल मन्दिरको ढोका खोल्ने र बन्द गर्ने कार्य चक्रवर्ति टोल सुधार समितिको रोहवरमा हुँदैआएको छ ।

data.d4ba6b94-6212-11eb-aaf1-0242ac130009:
NS 796 (Thursday, the 2nd of the bright fortnight of Jyeṣṭha)

Paramāna Viśvaṁbhara Bhāro consecrated a new statue of Umāmaheśvara in the newly reconstructed old three-storey temple.

data.2cfe60a8-6213-11eb-9e66-0242ac130009:
• Description: Social and religious activities here include:

    1. Fixing a trident or a copper image of Nandī to the door frame of the main entrance: people fix a trident or a copper image of Nandī above the main entrance of the temple to bring peace to passed souls. 

    2. Śivarātri: On the day of Śivarātri, local people gather in front of the temple, light a fire and drink bhāṅ (hemp leaf). 

    3. Special worship by Sanāḥ Guṭhī: Every year on the day of Thiṃlā Punhī, Sanāḥ Guṭhī (a guṭhī of Śreṣṭha and Jośī families of Cāka Bāhāḥ Ṭola) organises a special worship in the temple. At the end of the worship, people apply oil to the statue of Nandī that sits in front of the temple. People believe that those who are able to apply the oil perfectly and make the statue shine will be blessed with a son. 

    Reference source: None

data.c0dc905a-9910-11ea-9766-0242ac130005:
